oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Confederates Veterans' reunion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. James C. Carnahan, Co. G, 8th Tenn. (Smith's) Cav. Regt., CSA, is marked with an "x" in the photograph taken at the fairgrounds in Rutherford County. He was a prisoner scheduled to be executed in Murfreesboro when Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest raided and freed the prisoners on July 13, 1862. He fought at Perryville, Chickamauga, Murfreesboro, Missionary Ridge and Resaca and was later imprisoned at Louisville, Ky. He was sent to Ohio and released upon taking the oath of allegiance.
